content:
In preparation for adding controls for your own active/inactive status, we've stopped excluding the current user from the right sidebar user list. Here's one version of what that might look like (currently in master); I'm about to deploy here with a different version for comparison.
pasted image

I'd love feedback on how folks feel about this. There's two variables:

  • How we implement and style the "(you)" part. We need some special styling to distinguish from that being part of the name.
  • Whether we sort your to the top, or at your normal alphabetical place.
I'm slightly against "you" because of i18n concerns (tu vs. vous/usted/etc.)
Hmm, "me" doesn't have that, but feels awkward.
Yeah, I prefer just some sort of visual cue.

Here's a different choice for those two parameters:
pasted image
I would suggest something completely subtle like 2-pixel bottom padding or something. I think most people will get it pretty quickly, so we should err on the side of "looks nice" vs. "is intuitive"
I think I definitely like the opacity styling over the italics+font-weight.
or very slightly giving the top name a bolder font
I don't like bolder font, because it draws attention, and usually you don't want to be looking at that part of the page.
Yeah, I want to draw as little attention as possible.
I think a 5% increase of anything visual--whether it's font boldness, opacity, slight separation from the rest of the list--will be both easy to discover the first time while easy to tune out later.
I'm mostly arguing against any extra text.

“You” feels more awkward than “Me” as we want the user to feel ownership over the page. That’s why traditionally things are named “My Account” instead of “Your Account”.

In this case I feel like a combination of being sorted to the top and having “(me)” in a bold font with that faded gray colour would work fine.
I'll put in a vote for you. I think me is the right thing in some contexts, like if were writing me (Rishi Gupta), but it doesn't seem right as Rishi Gupta (me)?
Could also be something as simple as an asterisk referring back to text based chats
yeah, that could work. Agreed that symbolic solutions are better than either you or me.

I would prefer my own name to be at the top of the list. I think having your name always be at the top makes it easier to tune it out (in a good way) over the long haul, while still making it convenient if you want to do something like send a message to yourself. I also think it would also serve as kind of a visual reference point.
My thought is we'll probably want to move you to the top once we add some UI widgets attached to it, but it's kinda nice for it to be alphabetical while it doesn't have any UI controls.
Why not just add a dropdown for the own status next to the settings gear?

@Jakob I think it's plausible that we'll do it that way. I agree with @Tim Abbott that having widgets attached to your name will make it compelling to move your name to the top, but I think it actually makes sense now, too.
@Tim Abbott Any chance of putting the name to the top for a while to get feedback?

Why even show the name? How about just adding the the status circle next to the settings gear, and on the dropdown you can select your new status. I know my own name, I don't need it to be shown I think ;)

yeah, I think one proposal is to have something like
pasted image
(though with a square avatar and dropdown icon)
I thikn having the name there is better than having nothing, especially in less trafficked realms, and also unblocks implementing the status feature (one of our most frequent requests)

Why even show the name? How about just adding the the status circle next to the settings gear, and on the dropdown you can select your new status. I know my own name, I don't need it to be shown I think ;)

That's basically why we've never shown it up until now--most of us do indeed know our own name, and we know implicitly that we're present. I've just found over the years I'd rather have it explicit that I'm online. And the menu items attached to the buddy list make sense for me as well others--for example, I may wish to send a message to myself, and it's convenient. Or check my profile. And there's also the small-org case where only you are online, and we don't want a totally empty buddy list.
